metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15049 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in http/ContentLengthInterpreter.cc in Squid before 4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A Request Smuggling and Poisoning attack can succeed against the HTTP cache. The client sends an HTTP request with a Content-Length header containing "+\ "-" or an uncommon shell whitespace character prefix to the length field-value.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, "This attack requires an upstream server to participate in the smuggling and generate the poison response sequence."

criterions.comment: squid3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
